item.title: piping to ruby scripts
item.description: Ruby, instead of exiting when it receives a SIGPIPE, throws an exception Errno:EPIPE which usually results in a stack trace. ./foo.rb:8:in `write': Broken pipe - <STDOUT> (Errno::EPIPE) Here is the idiomatic one-line to simply exit when your script gets a SIGPIPE: trap('PIPE', 'EXIT')
